info.title: OpenAPI Plant Store
info.description: A sample API that uses a plant store as an example to demonstrate features in the OpenAPI specification

get.description: Returns all campaigns from the system that the user has access to

created_at.description: Timestamp when the campaign was created

display_name.description: Human-readable display name for the campaign

get.description: Returns session evaluation results for a specific campaign with detailed scoring and evaluations

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Start date for filtering results (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date for filtering results (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: starting_after
parameters.description: Pagination cursor - results after this big integer value

id.description: Unique identifier for the evaluation result

name.description: Name of the scenario that was evaluated

type.description: Type of scenario with key and label

key.description: Scenario type key (e.g., EMAIL, CHAT, THREADED_EMAIL)

label.description: Human-readable scenario type label (e.g., Email, Chat, Threaded Email)

eval_results.description: Detailed evaluation results for each skill assessed

skill.description: Skill being evaluated with key and label

label.description: Human-readable skill label (e.g., Judgment, Attention to Detail, Prioritization)

evaluated_at.description: Timestamp when the evaluation was performed

improvement_area.description: Detailed description of the improvement area

cefr.description: CEFR (Common European Framework of Reference for Languages) assessment

score.description: CEFR level (e.g., A1, A2, B1, B2, C1, C2)

created_at.description: Timestamp when the result was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the result was last updated

eval_results.rationale: The candidate makes reasonable decisions in straightforward situations but struggles with uncertainty, as seen in the inappropriate response to the CEO's complaint and ignoring the vague project email.
The candidate demonstrates acceptable accuracy but misses some details, such as responding as Alex inappropriately and ignoring a request for guidance, indicating a need for occasional corrections.

The candidate effectively prioritizes high-impact tasks, such as urgent investor presentation changes and confidential merger details, while also addressing routine matters, demonstrating proficient prioritization skills.

The candidate communicates with occasional errors and lapses in clarity, such as in the reasoning for Email Response Pair #1 and #5, but generally conveys the intended message. The responses show some tailoring to the audience, but there are instances of misjudgment, such as replying as the client in Email Response Pair #3, which affects professionalism.

The user demonstrates basic logical reasoning skills and attempts to evaluate information, but their responses often lack depth and consideration of multiple perspectives, such as ignoring the Project Phoenix email.

key_strengths.title: Communication Attempt
key_strengths.strength: You made an attempt to communicate, which is a foundational step in engaging with tasks. Building on this can help improve clarity and effectiveness in future interactions.

key_strengths.title: Willingness to Engage
key_strengths.strength: Your initial response indicates a willingness to participate. Harnessing this willingness with more structured and relevant content can enhance your contributions.

areas_for_growths.title: Enhancing AI Knowledge
areas_for_growths.improvement_area: Focus on engaging with AI-related content and discussions to build your knowledge and demonstrate understanding of AI capabilities and solutions.

areas_for_growths.title: Improving Communication Clarity
areas_for_growths.improvement_area: Work on structuring your responses with clear, logical flow to ensure your communication is coherent and accessible to your audience.

areas_for_growths.title: Developing Problem-Solving Skills
areas_for_growths.improvement_area: Engage more deeply with tasks to identify and address workflow challenges, showcasing your ability to solve problems effectively.

get.description: Returns role evaluation results for a specific campaign

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Start date for filtering results (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date for filtering results (YYYY-MM-DD format)

parameters.name: starting_after
parameters.description: Pagination cursor - results after this big integer value

id.description: Unique identifier for the result record

recommendation_status.description: Recommendation status for the user (e.g., NOT_RECOMMENDED, RECOMMENDED, STRONGLY_RECOMMENDED)

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign this result belongs to
Unique identifier of the user who generated this result

overall_score.description: User's overall proficiency score, ranging from 0 (lowest) to 5 (highest).

cefr.description: CEFR (Common European Framework of Reference for Languages) assessment

score.description: CEFR level (e.g., A1, A2, B1, B2, C1, C2)

created_at.description: Timestamp when the result record was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the result record was last updated

order_index.description: Order index used for sorting and pagination

has_more.description: Indicates whether there are more results available for pagination

last_record_index.description: The order index of the last record in the current page, used for pagination

data.description: Array of campaign result records with detailed score information

id.description: Unique identifier for the result record
Unique identifier of the campaign this result belongs to
Unique identifier of the user who generated this result

recommendation_status.description: Recommendation status for the user (e.g., NOT_RECOMMENDED, RECOMMENDED, STRONGLY_RECOMMENDED)

overall_score.description: Overall score representing the user's demonstrated proficiency level

cefr.description: CEFR (Common European Framework of Reference for Languages) assessment

score.description: CEFR level (e.g., A1, A2, B1, B2, C1, C2)

created_at.description: Timestamp when the result record was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the result record was last updated

order_index.description: Order index used for sorting and pagination

score_details.description: Detailed score breakdown for each scenario/session

id.description: Unique identifier for the score detail record

name.description: Name of the scenario that was evaluated

type.description: Type of scenario with key and label

key.description: Scenario type key (e.g., EMAIL, CHAT, THREADED_EMAIL)

label.description: Human-readable scenario type label (e.g., Email, Chat, Threaded Email)

eval_results.description: Detailed evaluation results for each skill

skill.description: Skill being evaluated with key and label

label.description: Human-readable skill label (e.g., Resourcefulness, Client Empathy)

evaluated_at.description: Timestamp when the evaluation was performed

created_at.description: Timestamp when the score detail was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the score detail was last updated

has_more.description: Indicates whether there are more results available for pagination

last_record_index.description: The order index of the last record in the current page, used for pagination

eval_results.rationale: The user adequately identifies and utilizes some resources and strategies, but lacks creativity and proactive seeking of new methods, resulting in a moderate impact on efficiency.
The user demonstrates excellent understanding of client needs and shows strong empathy in all interactions.

campaign_created_at.description: Timestamp when the campaign was created

campaign_display_name.description: Human-readable display name for the campaign

request_id.description: Unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging
